intro: Croton borbensis, commonly known as the Bornean croton, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Southeast Asia, particularly Borneo. It is a member of the Euphorbiaceae family, which includes many species with distinctive floral structures. The plant is characterized by its large, palmate leaves and bright yellow flowers that are often clustered in dense inflorescences. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in lowland rainforests. Due to its ornamental value and medicinal potential, it is of interest to botanists and horticulturists alike.
